column5: A relative late-comer to muskie, this retrospective article shares a personal evolution into that great hunt, highlighting a first 100 days fishing and exploring the St. Lawrence river... and myself. Not an astounding number of fish, what's more special about the Larry is the size. Link here if interested...https://bunksoutdoorangle.com/100-larry-days-of-muskie/ Bunk.

Really enjoyed that Bunk The top 10 lessons were worth the price of admission alone Years ago I would have put musky in my top 3 species fished along with bass and walleye With new places to fish where musky aren't on the menu I haven't targeted them in a few year but when I do again a read of your article again will be warranted AG
Awfully cruel of you to post this when it is still 15 weeks to opener. Great read!
Wow incredible report and love those pics, a bucket list fish for sure. Truly enjoy your reports

This was a long write man! Obviously took years just in fishing and record keeping alone, and hours thinking it through for the story. But muskies as you know, require every attention to detail. Quote: Originally Posted by MedyAwfully cruel of you to post this when it is still 15 weeks to opener. Great read!Awwww dood! Struggling this year waiting through the winter. Quote: Originally Posted by vteye3Wow incredible report and love those pics, a bucket list fish for sure. Truly enjoy your reportsThanks V. And thanks for reading guys.
